title: 103_hr1159
content:
The Act may be cited as the "Passenger Vessel Safety Act of 1993". Section 2101(21) of title 46, United States Code, is amended to define a 'passenger' as an individual carried on a vessel, excluding the owner, master, crew members not paying for carriage, or individuals under charter on an offshore supply vessel. The definition of a 'passenger' on a vessel includes individuals engaged in the owner's or charterer's business, as well as those involved in offshore mineral or energy resource activities. On a vessel, a 'passenger' excludes individuals engaged in the owner's or charterer's business, managing operators, and employees of the owner or charterer or their subcontractors. On a vessel, a 'passenger' excludes individuals engaged in the owner's or charterer's business, managing operators, and employees of the owner or charterer or their subcontractors, except for specific exceptions like sailing school instructors or students. SEC. 3. PASSENGER VESSEL. Amends the definition of a passenger vessel in title 46, United States Code, to include vessels of at least 100 gross tons carrying more than 12 passengers for hire, chartered vessels carrying more than 12 passengers, or submersible vessels carrying at least one passenger for hire. SEC. 4. SMALL PASSENGER VESSEL. SEC. 4. SMALL PASSENGER VESSEL. Amends the definition of a small passenger vessel in title 46, United States Code, to include vessels of less than 100 gross tons carrying more than 6 passengers for hire, chartered vessels with specified crew and more than 6 passengers, chartered vessels with no specified crew and more than 12 passengers, or submersible vessels carrying at least one passenger for hire. Section 2101(42) of title 46, United States Code, is amended to define an 'uninspected passenger vessel' as a vessel of at least 100 gross tons carrying not more than 12 passengers, or a vessel of less than 100 gross tons carrying not more than 6 passengers. An 'uninspected passenger vessel' is defined as a vessel carrying not more than 6 passengers, as specified by the owner or owner's representative. SEC. 6. PASSENGER FOR HIRE. Amends Section 2101 of title 46, United States Code, to define 'passenger for hire' as a passenger who pays for carriage on a vessel. SEC. 7. CONSIDERATION. Defines 'consideration' as an economic benefit accruing to an individual, person, or entity, excluding voluntary sharing of voyage expenses. 

SEC. 8. OFFSHORE SUPPLY VESSEL. Amends the definition of an offshore supply vessel to include individuals in addition to the crew.

SEC. 9. SAILING SCHOOL VESSEL. Amends the minimum number of individuals required on a sailing school vessel from at least 6 to more than 6. SEC. 10. SUBMERSIBLE VESSEL. Defines 'submersible vessel' as a vessel capable of operating below the water's surface. Section 2113 of title 46, United States Code, is amended to give the Secretary authority to exempt certain vessels from specific provisions if deemed unnecessary for their mission or safe operation. This includes issuing special permits for excursion vessels, exempting oceanographic research vessels, and establishing different requirements for certain passenger-carrying vessels. Within twenty-four months of enactment, the Secretary will require additional equipment for uninspected passenger vessels, such as liferafts or construction standards. SEC. 12. EFFECTIVE DATE.

Regulations for small passenger vessels and passenger vessels chartered without crew shall not apply before May 1, 1994. The Secretary may grant extensions for compliance if a good faith effort has been made but failed to meet the deadline.

SEC. 13. SENSE OF CONGRESS REGARDING USE OF U.S. CONSTRUCTED VESSELS FOR CARRYING PASSENGERS FOR HIRE. The Congress believes that vessels used for carrying passengers for hire in the United States should be constructed in the United States.
